content.en: Optical algorithm advancements: Scientists have developed various algorithms to solve complex problems in the field of optics. These algorithms, such as the fast iterative physical optics (FIPO) algorithm and the segment projection method in phase space, play a crucial role in analyzing scattering from large objects and approximating high-frequency wave propagation. Other algorithms, like the Fourier transform and the fractional Fourier transform (FRT), are used to calculate diffraction patterns in convergent systems. These advancements in algorithmic technology are enabling researchers to make significant progress in understanding and manipulating light.
content.da: Optiske algoritmefremskridt: Forskere har udviklet forskellige algoritmer til at løse komplekse problemer inden for optik. Disse algoritmer, såsom den hurtige iterative fysiske optik (FIPO) algoritme og segmentprojektionmetoden i fasespace, spiller en afgørende rolle i analysen af spredning fra store objekter og i at tage højde for højfrekvente bølgeudbredelser. Andre algoritmer, som Fourier-transformationen og den brøkdelige Fourier-transformation (FRT), bruges til at beregne diffraktionsmønstre i konvergente systemer. Disse fremskridt inden for algoritmeteknologi gør det muligt for forskere at gøre betydelige fremskridt i forståelsen og manipulationen af lys.
